title.value: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results
title.justification: This is the explicit title of the paper provided at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results

extractions.description: The paper discusses the utility of the shortest reactional distance (SRD) metric in enhancing the biological interpretation of metabolite genome-wide association studies (mGWAS) results. The authors introduce PathQuant, an R package developed to compute SRD between gene-metabolite pairs using the KEGG database. The study shows how SRD annotation can prevent false negatives and aid in identifying biologically relevant interactions that might be missed by traditional statistical methods alone.

type.justification: The paper includes analysis and results from real datasets derived from metabolite genome-wide association studies (mGWAS) to test the utility of the SRD metric.
type.quote: In this study, we assessed the utility of the shortest reactional distance (SRD) metric computed from KEGG databaseâ€™s pathways to annotate mGWAS results and to help extract biological insights from them.

name.justification: The study focuses on integrating genomics and metabolomics data to enhance the interpretation of mGWAS results using the SRD metric.
name.quote: Studies combining metabolomics and genetics, known as metabolite genome-wide association studies (mGWAS), have provided valuable insights into our understanding of the genetic control of metabolite levels.

name.justification: The study involves developing and applying an R package (PathQuant) for computing shortest reactional distances in metabolic pathways.
name.quote: We developed PathQuant, an R package, to enable a robust and systematic computation of SRD values between any lists of gene-metabolite pairs mapped onto KEGG graphs, which represent metabolic pathways, while keeping the original, well-curated, topology of each queried pathway.

name.justification: The study analyzes biological networks by computing SRD within the context of metabolic pathways.
name.quote: In this regard, recent studies have highlighted the applicability and utility of topological data analysis based on graph theory approaches [16], including the shortest path [17, 18], in revealing biological knowledge in the context of complex metabolic networks [13, 17, 18].

name.justification: This dataset was used to explore the results of the TK study, as it represents one of the largest mGWAS studies conducted to date.
name.quote: This mGWAS was done on a group of participants from European descent, and many findings were replicated in follow-up studies, making it a well-validated dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: An atlas of genetic influences on human blood metabolites
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper reports details about the TK study and its findings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This mGWAS was done on a group of participants from European descent, and many findings were replicated in follow-up studies, making it a well-validated dataset.

name.justification: The HMC study dataset was used to further test the approach in a different ethnic group, on Qatari individuals.
name.quote: we further tested our approach in the HMC study, which has been performed in a different ethnic group, on Qatari individuals.

referenced_paper_title.value: Whole-exome sequencing identifies common and rare variant metabolic QTLs in a Middle Eastern population
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides details about the HMC study and its findings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: we further tested our approach in the HMC study, which has been performed in a different ethnic group, on Qatari individuals.

name.justification: This dataset was used as a case study to show how the SRD metric can be used to prioritize novel hits in sickle cell disease patients.
name.quote: To exemplify how the SRD metric can be used to prioritize mGWAS results, we present a new mGWAS analysis performed in sickle cell disease (SCD) patients of African or African-American ancestry.

referenced_paper_title.value: Variation and impact of polygenic hematological traits in monogenic sickle cell disease
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides details about the SCD study and its findings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To exemplify how the SRD metric can be used to prioritize mGWAS results, we present a new mGWAS analysis performed in sickle cell disease (SCD) patients of African or African-American ancestry.

name.justification: The study introduces and discusses the development and use of the PathQuant R package to compute SRD values.
name.quote: We developed PathQuant, an R package, to enable a robust and systematic computation of SRD values between any lists of gene-metabolite pairs mapped onto KEGG graphs.

referenced_paper_title.value: No specific referenced paper; the library was contributed in this study
referenced_paper_title.justification: The PathQuant library was developed and introduced in the scope of this paper.
